title: MEAS MECH_ENG 495-0-22 Selected Topics in Mechanical Engg

instructors.instructor_addr: Technological Institute, Rm B226, 2145 Sheridan Rd, EV CAMPUS

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: As time permits, in this course the students will learn about historical energy usage; energy conservation vs. energy management; elements of an energy audit; data normalization of energy consumption using product-mix data or degree days etc.; utility rate structures & deregulation; energy economics; energy conservation opportunities in thermal-fluid Systems; combustion systems; steam & condensate Systems; energy recovery systems; industrial insulation; and electrical energy conservation.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: Thermodynamics offered through any department or graduate standing or consent of the instructor.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Homework and special assignments 30% Energy Audit 20% Contemporary Energy Topic of student/team choice and presentation 15% Exams 35% (midterm 15% and a final 20%)
